Description: Wall sherd (mended from three fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl with turn to foot; interior: streaky brown glaze; three friezes of alternating tongues and lotus flowers or buds painted in red and white, separated by red bands lined in white, details incised; tondo reserved with band of square and triglyph around centre motif; a red tongue is part-preserved. Exterior, cream slip: two friezes separated by bands with superimposed red bands lined in white; upper frieze is of goats to right, heads turned; below, lotus flower and bud chain with red additions; rays near foot join, above multiple thin lines and glazed area. One ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Joins 1888,0601.534a-b & d; from same bowl as e-g.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.237)
